name: licensed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
having a licence (= an official document) that gives you permission to own, do, or use something: a licensed pilotUK a licensed restaurant (= one that is allowed to sell alcohol)US a licensed daycare center He is not a licensed mental health counselor. See
license
More examplesFewer examplesMake sure you are dealing with a licensed massage therapist.Federal law prohibits licensed gun dealers from selling handguns to individuals under the age of 21.Sales of licensed baseball merchandise bring in about $100 million per year.

Add to word list
Add to word list
LAW, GOVERNMENT having official permission to do, have, or sell something: You should ensure that your investment adviser is licensed. The goods originated from state inspected and licensed facilities. a licensed driver/engineer/therapist a licensed broker/contractor/dealer
LAW, COMMERCE, IT produced, used, or sold with the permission of the person or company who has created something or owns something: About 300 licensed products will reach stores by the end of the year. The version of the software they were using was not licensed.
LAW, GOVERNMENT
  UK officially allowed to sell alcohol: Over the past 20 years, the number of licensed premises has increased by 23%. The restaurant is not licensed, but you can bring your own wine.
